title: How to Make Lemony Lemon Brownie Bars

steps.headline: Preheat oven to 350 °F (177 °C) before mixing ingredients.
steps.description: By preparing your oven before you begin to mix/bake you will be assured that your baking temperature will be correct.

steps.headline: Grease an 8x8 baking dish.
steps.description: Use either non-stick cooking spray or run a stick of butter along the bottom and sides of dish.

steps.headline: Juice and zest lemons.
steps.description: When juicing lemons, cut lemon in half and then squeeze lemon half, seed side upward (if you don't have a juicer). This will help you avoid seeds dropping into your juice. Lemon zest and juice can be placed in the same bowl.

steps.headline: Combine flour, sugar, salt and butter (brought to room temperature).
steps.description: For best results you an electric mixer with paddle attachment. Mix well until combined.

steps.headline: Whisk eggs, lemon zest and lemon juice in a large separate bowl.
Add egg/lemon mixture to flour mixture and combine well in electric mixture (for up to 2 minutes).
Pour into prepared baking dish.
steps.description: Smooth batter over with a rubber spatula. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove from oven when fully cooked and allow time to cool completely.
Make lemon glaze while brownies are cooling.
steps.description: Whisk powdered sugar, lemon juice and lemon zest together.

steps.headline: Drizzle glaze over brownies once fully cooled and spread glaze using rubber spatula.
Allow ample time for glaze to set before cutting into brownie squares and serving.

text: Preheat oven to 350 °F (177 °C) before mixing ingredients. By preparing your oven before you begin to mix/bake you will be assured that your baking temperature will be correct. Grease an 8x8 baking dish. Use either non-stick cooking spray or run a stick of butter along the bottom and sides of dish. Juice and zest lemons. When juicing lemons, cut lemon in half and then squeeze lemon half, seed side upward (if you don't have a juicer). This will help you avoid seeds dropping into your juice. Lemon zest and juice can be placed in the same bowl. Combine flour, sugar, salt and butter (brought to room temperature). For best results you an electric mixer with paddle attachment. Mix well until combined. Whisk eggs, lemon zest and lemon juice in a large separate bowl. Whisk until well combined. Add egg/lemon mixture to flour mixture and combine well in electric mixture (for up to 2 minutes).  Pour into prepared baking dish. Smooth batter over with a rubber spatula. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes. Remove from oven when fully cooked and allow time to cool completely.  Make lemon glaze while brownies are cooling. Whisk powdered sugar, lemon juice and lemon zest together. Drizzle glaze over brownies once fully cooled and spread glaze using rubber spatula.  Allow ample time for glaze to set before cutting into brownie squares and serving.
